content.text:
Perfect! I've successfully analyzed and fixed all the header styling issues across your EPL News Hub website. Here's what I accomplished:

## ✅ **Header Styling Issues Fixed:**

**1. Image Path Consistency**
- Fixed logo image path from `../upscalemedia-transformed.png` to `/upscalemedia-transformed.png` for consistent loading across all page locations

**2. Enhanced CSS Specificity**
- Added `!important` declarations to critical header styles to prevent conflicts with external stylesheets
- Ensured consistent background colors, borders, and layout properties

**3. Improved Layout Structure**
- Added proper header content container styling with max-width and centering
- Enhanced logo and header utilities layout with flexbox properties
- Fixed navigation styling for consistent appearance

**4. Mobile Responsiveness**
- Enhanced mobile header styles with stronger specificity
- Added proper sticky positioning and shadow effects for mobile
- Optimized logo sizing and text scaling for small screens

**5. CSS Reset Integration**
- Added comprehensive CSS reset specifically for header elements
- Eliminated potential conflicts from inherited styles
- Ensured consistent button, link, and typography behavior

**6. Cross-Browser Compatibility**
- Added box-sizing border-box for all header elements
- Standardized margin and padding resets
- Enhanced mobile viewport handling

Your header.html file now includes robust, self-contained styling that will display consistently across:
- All pages (homepage, articles, premium pages)
- All screen sizes (desktop, tablet, mobile)
- All browsers and devices
- Different directory structures within your site

The header will maintain its professional NYT-style appearance with proper navigation, search functionality, and responsive behavior on every page of your website.
I'll help you push the changes to git. Let me first check the current status and then push the changes.

content.text: Now I'll add the important header changes and commit them before pushing:

input.command:
git commit -m "$(cat <<'EOF'
Fix header styling consistency across all pages

- Fixed logo image path from relative to absolute for consistent loading
- Enhanced CSS specificity with !important declarations to prevent conflicts  
- Added comprehensive header CSS reset for cross-browser consistency
- Improved mobile responsive header styling with sticky positioning
- Enhanced navigation dropdown positioning and z-index management
- Added stronger header container styling with proper max-width and centering
- Fixed potential styling conflicts with external CSS files

🤖 Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.ai/code)

Co-Authored-By: Claude <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
)"

content.text: Perfect! I can see we're already in the EPL News Hub directory itself. The changes have been made to header.html. Now let me check if there are any unstaged changes and push them:

input.description: Check git status for any unstaged changes

input.command:
git commit -m "$(cat <<'EOF'
Fix header styling consistency across all pages

- Fixed logo image path from relative to absolute for consistent loading
- Enhanced CSS specificity with !important declarations to prevent conflicts  
- Added comprehensive header CSS reset for cross-browser consistency
- Improved mobile responsive header styling with sticky positioning
- Enhanced navigation dropdown positioning and z-index management
- Added stronger header container styling with proper max-width and centering
- Fixed potential styling conflicts with external CSS files

🤖 Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.ai/code)

Co-Authored-By: Claude <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
)"

content.text:
Perfect! I've completely enhanced the sidebar FPL tools ads with much better styling. Here's what I've accomplished:

## ✅ **Enhanced Sidebar FPL Tools Ads - Complete Makeover:**

### **🎨 Visual Improvements:**

**1. Modern Card Design**
- Gradient backgrounds with subtle animations
- 3D hover effects with scaling and shadows
- Enhanced border-radius and modern spacing
- Subtle background overlays for depth

**2. Animated Elements**
- Pulsating "MOST POPULAR" badges with gradient shifts
- 3D rotating icons with glow effects

## ✅ Budget Optimizer Enhancement Complete

### Key Features Implemented:

1. **🏆 Team of the Week Functionality**

   - Displays detailed analysis and strategy explanations

2. **📱 Enhanced Layout & Organization**
   - Modern gradient animations and visual effects
   - Improved button styling with hover states
   - Better organized sections with clear visual hierarchy
   - Responsive design considerations

3. **🎯 Interactive Features**
   - Smooth scrolling to relevant sections
   - Success notifications with clear instructions
   - Integration with strategy selector (sets to "Best Team")
   - Toggle functionality for showing/hiding details

### How It Works:

1. **Team of the Week Button**: When clicked, it reveals a curated expert team with detailed analysis
2. **Formation Integration**: Automatically configures the optimizer to use the recommended 3-5-2 formation
3. **Seamless Workflow**: Users can then click "Optimize My Squad" to find similar players within their budget constraints

The budget optimizer now provides a much more organized and engaging experience, with the Team of the Week feature serving as an excellent starting point for users who want expert guidance before customizing their own squads.
I'll commit the budget optimizer improvements and push them to the repository.

Swedish striker Alexander Isak in Newcastle colors
The £63m signing has refused to play for Newcastle amid Liverpool interest

In a dramatic escalation shaking the Premier League, Alexander Isak has vowed never to play for Newcastle United again, igniting widespread Alexander Isak transfer news. The 25-year-old Swedish striker's Isak Newcastle refusal comes amid strong Liverpool interest, with the Reds' £110 million bid rejected but still in play. As the 2025 summer transfer window nears its close on September 1, this Alexander Isak Newcastle standoff could force a last-minute deal, impacting Newcastle United transfer updates and Premier League 2025/26 season dynamics.

Alexander Isak Newcastle Career: From Record Signing to Refusal Drama

Alexander Isak arrived at Newcastle United in August 2022 from Real Sociedad for a club-record £63 million, marking a pivotal Newcastle United transfer in their post-takeover rebuild. The forward's impact was immediate: in the 2022/23 Premier League season, Isak scored 10 goals in 22 appearances, aiding a top-four finish and Champions League qualification.

£150M

By 2023/24, Alexander Isak elevated his game, netting 21 goals in 30 matches and leading Newcastle to Carabao Cup glory—their first major trophy in decades. In 2024/25, he added 18 goals and 7 assists in 28 games, boasting 85% pass accuracy, 4.1 shots per game, and 2.4 dribbles per 90.

Key Point: Despite these feats, frustrations mounted. Newcastle's 8th-place finish last season with 58 points clashed with Isak's ambitions, fueling the Alexander Isak refuses to play for Newcastle narrative. Sources indicate he feels undervalued, viewing his Newcastle tenure as over despite a contract until 2028.

August 12, 2025

Reports from The Athletic confirmed Alexander Isak informed Eddie Howe and Newcastle officials of his firm stance: no more games for the Magpies, even post-window.

Liverpool's £110M Bid

Liverpool's offer was turned down, but they persist, eyeing Isak as a frontline upgrade alongside Mohamed Salah.

Newcastle's Response

Newcastle demands £150 million+, but Isak's holdout risks devaluing him. Eddie Howe noted the decision involves the board amid PSR concerns.

Why the Alexander Isak Newcastle Rift? Ambition vs Reality

The Alexander Isak transfer news stems from perceived underappreciation. Despite delivering Champions League football and a potential £130 million sale profit, Isak seeks bigger stages.

Facing the 2025/26 Premier League opener against Aston Villa on August 16, Newcastle must decide: sell and reinvest or stand firm? A prolonged Alexander Isak standoff could breach PSR via unused wages, while losing him hampers goals. content.text: ✅ **Fixed! Isak Article Width Consistency Restored** ## 🛠️ **Problem Solved:** ### **Issue Identified:** - **Duplicate closing `` tag** was prematurely ending the `.modern-article` container - **Second half of article** was displaying full-width instead of maintaining the 800px max-width - **Content structure** was broken due to malformed HTML ### **Fix Applied:** - **Removed extra ``** on line 592 that was closing the container too early - **Restored proper nesting** of all content within the `.modern-article` container - **Ensured consistent width** and styling throughout the entire article ### **Result:** - ✅ **Consistent 800px max-width** throughout the entire article - ✅ **Proper centering** and padding maintained in both halves - ✅ **Clean HTML structure** with correct container nesting - ✅ **Professional layout** from start to finish **Commit:** `a047a32` - "Fix Isak article container structure and width consistency" The article now maintains the same polished, centered layout throughout both halves! 🎯
